extendedInfo.description: This app uses an intelligent algorithm to teach Chinese characters using flashcards. The characters are based on the Jun Da Character frequency list of Modern Chinese. Definitions are from CC-CEDICT.kw: study chinese characters, learn chinese characters, learn chinese, study chinese, kanzi, chinese flashcards, flashcards, flash cards, tool, chinois, Chinesisch, ä¸­å½èª, chinese input, chinese chess, chinese keyboard, study chinese, traditional, simplified

reviews.title: Worth 10 times what it costs
reviews.comment: 5000 Hanzi in simplified or traditional with a good test engine. My 4 boxes of Tuttle flash cards ($100+) are better. Nothing else I know of can compete.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Frustrating
reviews.comment: I am stuck at 385 words, while studying for a year in china... a lot of strange words for which i have no clue of a possible use... i believe now i should validate words i don\'t know in order to access to words corresponding to my vocabulary... too bad!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useful but limited
reviews.comment: To be able to scroll back to previously presented characters would be useful.  Also would prefer smaller learning set repeated at shorter intervals.  And you have to have the free version installed to open the paid version.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great app. Would be 5 stars if the flash cards had example sentences and words. Learning characters in isolation is less useful!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simple
reviews.comment: Simple app. For me too many new characters are \'released\' so it\'s Hertz to remember them all. Other than that, quite a useful app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Slick, but lacking proper pinyin
reviews.comment: I don\'t like the tone numbers written at the end of each transliteration. Proper pinyin tone marks would convince me to buy the full version.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Excellent. Improvement: add part of speech to definition and have sound available when flipping. Hopefully will see those in the next update!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: The best Chinese character learning app available!
reviews.comment: This is by far the best Chinese character learning app available on the market. I tried many before this one and there is no comparison. It\'s easy to use, intuitive and very helpful. There was no doubt i was going to upgrade to the Pro version after using the free version a couple of times. I had some trouble installing the Pro version but everything was solved after an email to the developer. \350\260\242\350\260\242\357\274\201
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: After the first 3 or 4 characters in a session, the characters no longer display. I\'m using a T-mobile G2 win Android 2.2.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Nice app but only 100 characters are free. After that you have to upgrade.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A suggestion
reviews.comment: It would be helpful to have a Visible saved list of the characters you already know,  so you can consulte it anytime you want.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Basic interface and average learning. Room for improvement
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Can be better.
reviews.comment: Please add reset function or profile function to support multi-users.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: +easy to use
reviews.comment: +great character selection choice -cannot view already marked characters -characters use screen space ineffectively *add audio or text 2 speech lib
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Rub\303\251n
reviews.comment: Excellent, This app make you practice at any moment. Love it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I have the same problem as a previous commenter on a G2. Flip to a definition,and flip back to the character but the screen is now blank.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Would like to view already marked characters
reviews.author: A Google User
